summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case of United States v. Maxwell, regarding the production of additional discovery materials. The email discusses logistical details for delivering the discovery to both the defense team and the defendant, Ghislaine Maxwell, who is incarcerated at the MDC.

events.title: Discovery Letter Prepared
events.description: A cover letter regarding discovery production in the US v. Maxwell case was prepared and attached to the email.

events.title: Discovery Production Communication
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney communicated with defense counsel about an additional discovery production ready for delivery to the defense team and the incarcerated defendant.

locations: MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center, likely in Brooklyn, NY)
keyFacts: The document is a 2021 email from the US Attorney's Office to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team regarding ongoing discovery in her criminal case.
Ghislaine Maxwell was incarcerated at the MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center) at the time of this communication.
The discovery production consisted of PDFs and was to be delivered via an FTP site to the defense and on a CD to Maxwell in prison.
The defense team included attorneys Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, Mark S. Cohen, and Jeff Pagliuca.
The correspondence illustrates the procedural aspects of evidence sharing between prosecution and defense in a high-profile federal case.
